prompt:
Do you know ARC problem?

It is similary below.

=========
Example 1

If input grids are like that
[[0, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0], [0, 3, 0, 2, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 2, 0, 0], [0, 8, 0, 0, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 2, 2], [6, 6, 6, 0, 0, 0]],
then this grids change to output grids below
[[0, 0, 0, 0, 3, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0, 3, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2], [0, 0, 0, 8, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 6, 6, 6]].

=========

You can understand the pattern of this problem with input-output pair about example1.
In above case, you can inference like below.

In example 1 case, all obejct move right. So if given input is below,
[[0, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0], [0, 3, 0, 2, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 2, 0, 0], [0, 8, 0, 0, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 2, 2], [6, 6, 6, 0, 0, 0]],
then you can move object to right side.
[[0, 0, 0, 0, 3, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0, 3, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2], [0, 0, 0, 8, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 0, 2, 2], [0, 0, 0, 6, 6, 6]].

Like this concept, 'object', 'count', 'color', 'move', 'row', 'column' and etc, helps you to understand patterns of problem and solve it.

Below problem is other pattern to solve. So you can understand below pattern with several examples and apply quiz's input to get right output.

=========

=========
Q1: Identify the unique numbers in the grid.
A1: The unique numbers in the grid are 0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.


Q2: For each unique number, identify the cells that are connected to each other (horizontally or vertically).
A2: A2: 

- For 0: All the cells that do not contain any other number are connected to each other.
- For 1: There are several groups of connected cells. One large group is in the bottom right corner, another group is in the middle of the grid, and there are several smaller groups scattered throughout the grid.
- For 3: There is only one cell with the number 3, so it is not connected to any other cells.
- For 4: There is only one cell with the number 4, so it is not connected to any other cells.
- For 5: There is only one cell with the number 5, so it is not connected to any other cells.
- For 6: There is only one cell with the number 6, so it is not connected to any other cells.
- For 7: There is only one cell with the number 7, so it is not connected to any other cells.
- For 8: There is only one cell with the number 8, so it is not connected to any other cells.


Q3: For each group of connected cells, identify the cells that are on the boundary of the group.
A3: A3: 

- For 0: The boundary cells are the ones that are adjacent to any cell containing a number other than 0.
- For 1: The boundary cells are the ones that are adjacent to any cell containing a number other than 1. This includes the cells on the outer edges of the large group in the bottom right corner and the middle of the grid, as well as the individual cells scattered throughout the grid.
- For 3: Since there is only one cell with the number 3, it is considered a boundary cell.

Q4: For each boundary cell, identify the cells that are adjacent to it but not part of the group.
A4: A4: 

- For 0: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 0.
- For 1: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 1. This includes the cells that are next to the large group in the bottom right corner and the middle of the grid, as well as the cells that are next to the individual cells scattered throughout the grid.
- For 3: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 3. In this case, these are the cells that are next to the single cell with the number 3.
- For 4: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 4. In this case, these are the cells that are next to the single cell with the number 4.

- For 7: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 7. In this case, these are the cells that are next to the single cell with the number 7.
- For 8: The adjacent cells that are not part of the group are the ones that contain any number other than 8. In this case, these are the cells that are next to the single cell with the number 8.


Q5: For each group of connected cells, identify the unique numbers of the cells identified in Q4.
A5: A5: 

- For 0: The unique numbers of the adjacent cells that are not part of the group are 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.
- For 1: The unique numbers of the adjacent cells that are not part of the group are 0, 3, 5, 7, 8.

- For 8: The unique numbers of the adjacent cells that are not part of the group are 0, 1.


Q6: For each group of connected cells, if the unique numbers identified in Q5 are the same as the number of the group, change the cells in the group to that number.
A6: A6: 

- For 0: The unique numbers of the adjacent cells are not the same as the number of the group, so the cells in the group are not changed.
- For 1: The unique numbers of the adjacent cells are not the same as the number of the group, so the cells in the group are not changed.

A7: A7: A7:

Q8: For each cell that is not part of any group, change the cell to the number that is most common among its adjacent cells.
